Posts.Content: SchnauzerMom wrote: Good morning all, I've been wondering about new meds in the pipeline, and I know that many of you on this forum are knowledgable about research and trials. It could be informative and hopeful to have a list of these. If you are aware of new meds on the near or mid-near horizon, could you post? Thanks! (Particularly interested in meds for ER+) mets to liver, bones Dx 11/21/1987, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/11/1989, ILC, Stage IIIA, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/9/1990 CMF Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Femara (letrozole) Dx 7/31/2012, ILC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+ Targeted Therapy 1/14/2013 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 1/14/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 11/9/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 4/1/2014 Navelbine (vinorelbine) Hormonal Therapy 7/22/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 7/22/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Chemotherapy 11/12/2014 Doxil (doxorubicin) Chemotherapy 7/12/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 12/2/2016 Halaven (eribulin) Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 7/18/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New meds in pipeline? SchnauzerMom SchnauzerMom

Posts.Content: SchnauzerMom wrote: Any advice about Ixempra? I'll be starting it and Xeloda tomorrow. Scan yesterday showed liver progression. Been on Afinitor and Aromasin since July, but they didn't work for me (and chemo before that). I have hope for the Ixempra and Xeloda combination. Any encouraging experiences? Thanks. mets to liver, bones Dx 11/21/1987, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/11/1989, ILC, Stage IIIA, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/9/1990 CMF Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Femara (letrozole) Dx 7/31/2012, ILC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+ Targeted Therapy 1/14/2013 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 1/14/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 11/9/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 4/1/2014 Navelbine (vinorelbine) Hormonal Therapy 7/22/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 7/22/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Chemotherapy 11/12/2014 Doxil (doxorubicin) Chemotherapy 7/12/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 12/2/2016 Halaven (eribulin) Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 7/18/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ixempra info, encouragement? SchnauzerMom RonnieKay

Posts.Content: SchnauzerMom wrote: I've been on Taxol and Avastin since January (Femara, Faslodex and Xgeva, also, since last July).  First three months with the Taxol and Avastin were okay.  But I swear those side effects keep intensifying.  Infusions are on Tuesday, and usually by Saturday I'd get some energy.  Not happening.  All that's happening is diarrhea, then I just feel weaker and crappier.  Almost feel like I'm fading away.  Have a scan next Friday, and if liver is better, I will get to go off the Taxol and Avastin for a while.  If not, probably start Navelbine.  Has anybody had a progressively hard time on this regimen?  I can take the neuropathy, but the weakness is dehumanizing. mets to liver, bones Dx 11/21/1987, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/11/1989, ILC, Stage IIIA, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/9/1990 CMF Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Femara (letrozole) Dx 7/31/2012, ILC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+ Targeted Therapy 1/14/2013 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 1/14/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 11/9/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 4/1/2014 Navelbine (vinorelbine) Hormonal Therapy 7/22/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 7/22/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Chemotherapy 11/12/2014 Doxil (doxorubicin) Chemotherapy 7/12/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 12/2/2016 Halaven (eribulin) Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 7/18/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: SchnauzerMom wrote: Got my PET scan results today.  Liver looks better!  Oncologist thinks I have myelodysplasia, so will have a bone marrow biospy in two weeks (as soon as we return from visiting our daughter in Florida, whose second baby is due today!!). If you have dealt with this, please could you tell me about your treatment, how you are, and any advice you have.  Thanks! Judy  mets to liver, bones Dx 11/21/1987, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/11/1989, ILC, Stage IIIA, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/9/1990 CMF Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Femara (letrozole) Dx 7/31/2012, ILC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+ Targeted Therapy 1/14/2013 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 1/14/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 11/9/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 4/1/2014 Navelbine (vinorelbine) Hormonal Therapy 7/22/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 7/22/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Chemotherapy 11/12/2014 Doxil (doxorubicin) Chemotherapy 7/12/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 12/2/2016 Halaven (eribulin) Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 7/18/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: SchnauzerMom wrote: I was saddened to learn today that Crone passed away earlier this month. She had posted several times on the Stage IV boards. Some of you met her on the Halaven, Aromasin/Afinitor, and Over 60 and Over 70 threads. She was gracious, compassionate, and kind. (We shared several PMs, and joked about merging Lady Julian of Norwich's quote "All shall be well, all shall be well, and all manner of thing shall be well" with Steve Jobs' reported last words "Oh wow! Oh wow! Oh wow!" We signed our messages "Be wow.") Be wow, Phyllis! Forever Link to obituary: http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/name/phyllis-scanlon-obituary?pid=1000000184313071 mets to liver, bones Dx 11/21/1987, ILC, <1cm, Stage I, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 12/11/1989, ILC, Stage IIIA, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 1/9/1990 CMF Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy 7/30/2012 Femara (letrozole) Dx 7/31/2012, ILC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+ Targeted Therapy 1/14/2013 Avastin (bevacizumab) Chemotherapy 1/14/2013 Taxol (paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 11/9/2013 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel) Chemotherapy 4/1/2014 Navelbine (vinorelbine) Hormonal Therapy 7/22/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Targeted Therapy 7/22/2014 Afinitor (everolimus) Chemotherapy 11/12/2014 Doxil (doxorubicin) Chemotherapy 7/12/2016 Xeloda (capecitabine) Chemotherapy 12/2/2016 Halaven (eribulin) Hormonal Therapy 5/31/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 7/18/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply
